title: Neidpath Tunnel and Castle Walk Route

images.title: Neidpath Castle Peebles by DTwigg, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Neidpath Castle Peebles

images.title: Neidpath Viaduct by kim traynor, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Neidpath Viaduct. Also known as the Queen's Bridge, the structure consists of eight stone skew arches. It was built to carry the Symington to Peebles branch line of the Caledonian Railway over the River Tweed to the south-west of Neidpath Castle.

images.title: Old Neidpath Viaduct over the River Tweed by Oliver Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cyclists on top of Neidpath Viaduct over the River Tweed

images.title: Jim Barton / East portal, Neidpath Tunnel
images.caption: East portal, Neidpath Tunnel

images.title: Chris Heaton / River Tweed near Neidpath Castle
images.caption: River Tweed near Neidpath Castle. Following the riverside path from Peebles to the ancient Neidpath Castle, which stands high above the Tweed in the section seen ahead in this photograph.

images.title: River Tweed by frank smith, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: River Tweed

images.title: Walter Baxter / Hay Lodge Park, Peebles
images.caption: Hay Lodge Park, Peebles

images.title: M J Richardson / Fotheringham Bridge across the Tweed at Peebles
images.caption: Fotheringham Bridge across the Tweed at Peebles

description: This circular walk explores the old Neidpath Railway in Peebles, in the Scottish Borders. On the way you will also visit the viaduct and the Neidpath Tunnel, which you can walk right through. The walk starts in Peebles town centre and then picks up a footpath heading west along the River Tweed to the pretty Hay Lodge Park. You'll pass the historic Neidpath Castle before coming to the viaduct. You can cross the river here and enjoy some fine views over the area from the elevated position. The route then enters the tunnel where you advised to bring a flashlight or torch so you can safely walk through to the other side. After exiting the tunnel you continue along the river before passing the weir and crossing Peebles Bridge to return to the town. To continue your railway walking in the area, head to the eastern side of town to pick up the Tweed Valley Railway Path. This will take you to Innerleithen along a pleasant shared cycling and walking trail. You can also access the excellent mountain bike trails and waymarked walks in the expansive Glentress Forest from the route.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Also nearby is the Gypsy Glen Walk. The multi user route explores Cardrona Forest and the hills to the south of Peebles. It is popular with mountain bikers.

display_address: A72, New Town, Peebles, Scottish Borders, Alba / Scotland, EH45 8FE, United Kingdom
